alert.note: Alert for Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:16AM EST until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Lingering flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, Clinton and Warren. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 914 AM EST, local law enforcement reported flooding and high water lingering in numerous locations across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen, with no additional rainfall expected. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Middletown, Mason, Lebanon, Springboro, Wilmington, Monroe, Loveland, Franklin, Carlisle, Blanchester, Waynesville, Sabina, Lynchburg, New Vienna, Morrow, Kings Island, Hunter, Highpoint, South Lebanon and Maineville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
